intro: Psoralea incana, commonly known as the whitethorn psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea incana is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
